introduction: 芬兰湾沿海，原住的芬兰-乌格尔人有着自己传承千年的歌唱传统，一种与神秘力量相关联的称作Regilaul的民歌。它深深根植于爱沙尼亚的歌唱文化。歌曲在简单却又隽永的8音节韵文下反反复复，瞬间就产生一种奇异的音景，将稍纵即逝的此刻送往永恒的生命之圈。纪录片遍访深爱并沉醉于此种音乐的爱沙尼亚人，音乐家、教授、歌者、作家，并以大量的现实或历史的音乐影像片段，探索Regilaul在如今是如何依然能激发想象力的。On the shores of the Gulf of Finland, the ancient Finno-Ugric Peoples originated a singing tradition of mysterious power called the Regilaul.These songs are the roots of Estonia's renowned singing culture. Based on the continuous repetition of eight-syllable verses, they produce a haunting sound able to connect the fleeting present with the eternal circle of life. Against the stunning setting of modern Estonia, this film explores how Regi songs still fire the imagination today, weaving together people and nature through song.
